DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information relating to the time for the MRI Simulation process. The time from MRI bed preparation to the time completed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Preparation Complete Elapsed Time
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Total time required for MRI simulation process, in preparation for delivery of radiation therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act or process of making something ready.:To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:The interval between two reference points in time.

Concepts.definition: The act or process of making something ready.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
The interval between two reference points in time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ISO 8061 time recorded as hh:mm:ss based on a 24 hour clock.   Precision can be truncated by omitting the seconds or both the seconds and minutes (23:59 or 23).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.  It may also refer to a specific point in this continuum or to the interval separating two points.  It is generally measured in minutes, days, months, or years.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 6/30/17 jk transferred context; added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 8/29/13 curated for the CFR Standardization work. tt

ReferenceDocuments.name: Time of MRI bed preparation t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Time of MRI bed preparation to time when ready to start with next patient
